page.title: 09Warkton's charm, Kettering.
page.content: People who were interviewed said that the village itself had not changed greatly over the years. However, there were many new people and few who were born in the village remained. It is pleasing to see that properties and the churchyard are so well cared for. The former village school is used as a meeting room and the old bakery has been converted to a house. An elderly resident remembers villagers taking their Sunday dinners to be cooked at the bakery while they were in church! Much traffic by-passes Kettering leaving the A43 and making for the A6 via the edge of Warkton. Elsewhere in the village all is quiet. The Post Office is in the front room of a house and is open for rather less hours than larger places elsewhere.
